name: smart-tree
description: Revolutionary AI-optimized directory tree with MEM|8 Quantum compression - 99% token reduction
long_description:
Smart Tree v2.0 revolutionizes directory visualization with MEM|8 Quantum compression, reducing output by 99% and saving thousands in AI token costs.

Key Features:
- **MEM|8 Quantum Format**: 99% size reduction (487MB â†’ 4.1MB for Chromium)
- **Cost Savings**: $1,270 saved per large directory analysis
- **10-24x Faster**: Than traditional tree command
- **Native Quantum Output**: Zero conversion overhead
- Multiple output formats (quantum, hex, json, csv, tsv, ai-optimized)
- Smart filtering by file type, size, date, and content
- Built-in compression for all formats
- MCP server integration with 20+ specialized tools
- Cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux)

prompts.name: find_recent_document
prompts.description: Help find a document worked on recently
prompts.text: Please help me find ${arguments.document_type} documents I was working on ${arguments.timeframe}. Use find_recent_changes to search for recently modified files, then filter by document types like .doc, .docx, .txt, .md, or .pdf.

prompts.name: analyze_disk_usage
prompts.description: Find what files are using disk space
prompts.text: What files are eating up my hard drive space? Please use directory_size_breakdown to analyze the current directory and subdirectories, then use find_large_files to identify the biggest space consumers. Provide a summary of where space is being used.

prompts.name: compare_duplicate_folders
prompts.description: Compare duplicate folders to find the most recent
prompts.text: Could you see which of these duplicate ${arguments.folder_type} folders have the latest files? First use find_duplicates to identify potential duplicate directories, then use compare_directories and find_recent_changes to determine which has the most recent updates.

prompts.name: organize_project
prompts.description: Analyze and organize a project directory
prompts.text: Please analyze the project at ${arguments.project_path} using analyze_workspace. Identify the project type, find all code files, configuration files, and documentation. Suggest an organization structure based on best practices.

prompts.name: cleanup_empty_dirs
prompts.description: Find and suggest removal of empty directories
prompts.text: Can you help me clean up empty directories? Use find_empty_directories to identify all empty folders, then provide a list organized by location. Suggest which ones are safe to remove.

prompts.name: find_all_code
prompts.description: Find all code files in a directory
prompts.text: Find all ${arguments.languages} code files in the current directory. Use find_code_files with the specified languages and provide a summary organized by file type and location.

prompts.name: search_content
prompts.description: Search for specific content in files
prompts.text: Search for '${arguments.search_term}' in ${arguments.file_types} files. Use search_in_files to find all occurrences and show me which files contain this term with line numbers.

prompts.name: project_health_check
prompts.text: Perform a comprehensive health check on this project. Use project_overview for the structure, find_tests to check test coverage, find_documentation to verify docs, and get_statistics for overall metrics. Provide insights and recommendations.
